name: gauntly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that emphasizes how thin someone is, especially when they are sick or hungry: A photograph of the Prime Minister showed him staring gauntly at the camera. His face stared back at me from the screen - still strikingly, gauntly handsome.
More examplesFewer examplesAt the end of last year her clothes were getting tight, and now she's gauntly thin.Now his face - gauntly handsome - appears on posters all over the London Underground.A performance by the great pianist - a gauntly handsome man in his early thirties - was a rare event.
